column5: I'll meet you halfway, Simon. For me that would be Hearst. Good fishing up that way too.
True Roy, but, after watching a bunch of Simon's videos...you wouldn't have to twist my arm too hard to go fishing up in his area, lol!!
I will take a wild guess that asking 275 bucks a ticket has something to do with it!! Same ticket at the Ralph goes for 95 bucks!!!  They can shove the 275 up their   !!!
Ibelieve there is a g2g in june, (see this thread) one in feb.. (by the way this years fishing for Tyler event is Feb 25th, 2012) and theres usually a BOQ one as well!
Thanks TJ, I was checking the Tyler one out last night and thought i had missed it but i see 20 ( 12 ) thing now .
Would this event be like a "Swill"?  Also, Hello!
HEY!!!!!!!!!!!! Figeon Pisher!!!! Yup, and a swell swill it is! How's the thin man and the family? Nice to hear from you Steve.

Hey Roy, et all.  Still slim, still familying.  Southern PA has treated us very well over the past three years.  I often think back to some great OFC times that have been had over the years.  I have traded in my fishing rod for running shoes as a general hobby, relaxing in its own way.  Nice to see a lot of the old faces on here still.  Fall fishing was always my favorite.  Trolling Pigeon Lake for a morning, getting back to the cottage with the smell of chili and perhaps a couple cold beers to recharge for the afternoon.  Be well...
sw sw sw sw what ! but thanks Roy ............
If this does happen to happen, how about turning it into a swap meet??
I had to give up the wife swapping stuff but thanks
You got bad ratings eh bud?
no they kept on giving her back.....LOL       if she reads this I am dead..

The first one I went to was Dec 27th not sure the year but it was a few days ago I headed the 2.5 hours from Chatham to the fire hall just for the wings and to say HI to many people I have never met face to face yet my wife thought (knew) I was crazy/nutz to go but she understands now as many of the people I met that night are life long friends now. We have had them in London with good numbers showing up I would travel to more of them but they are usually on week days and I start work way to early to be out all night.  They are a great time and great way to meet other members. I like the idea of a swap meet thing set up for members to come out and set up tables to sell there tackle I might be interested in this if it were a weekend thing Kinda like the toy swap meets in a hotel banquet room?

. I   Thanks for telling how it can be , i'd like to do something down the road maybe and once i've mastered the sport a bit more . In the mean time its watch and learn from the good people on this site and share back what i can .  Thank you Mike .

add the tackel swap/sell/trade to a G2G is a great idea!  I have so much now that I don't use it's crazy (don't let my wife know!) so I would like to be there too if it all works out.  that and meeting the OFC/OFC'ers that I have yet to meet.

Available for TRADE:  All this crap that doesn't work for other crap that doesn't work that I haven't tried yet....  .....no refunds...  God, I could easily open up my own tackle shop with all the crap I have above my boat (rafters in garage)....WAY too much crap to list on Craig's list or Ebay...LOL....I need to take some of this "stuff" to my son Billy, so he can store it in his garage...
Your new avitar pic is going to give someone a stroke..
Musky's Landing has great rates...huge property and sweet spring fishing..Hotel and Cottages on site...I'd be in forsure!
Not as good as 6X or Bountiful... but it's darn close without going across the pond for a pint!
Great idea,it would prolly look like this.  I would attend for sure,unless it looked like this.  I would not want any part of that. Joe

Thanks for the laughs on some of those replies guys.  Perhaps the search engine should be used just a "wee" bit more by new members of our community. Appreciate what you are trying to do Skipper, but, you kind of put your foot in your mouth on this one. However, nothing wrong with another get together.
Holy crap batman, if that's where I think it is, that water is LOOOOOW and the boat flipper probably didn't see much action
that was 2 years ago
but i like being the forehead behind the board fence ....

Thanks every one for reading and helping in turning the thread round& round .  Yes i did find the answer to my question , it dose happen in ways i did'nt expect i am glad to hear but i did wonder if there was such a thing held for OFC members . Perhapes after i've been here for a while and get to know more of the good people on the site i will provoke such an event . For now i am  .. lol . Thanks all
bingo! It was pouring out and I couldn't carry a whole case in my state anyway
did you find anybody willing to get together in Toronto area (GTA) ?

I've attended the Oakville swill a few times in the past. Always nice to meet some of the regulars on the board and the new members too. Lots of friendships and fishing partners found at these events.
Not shure about T.O. but its being contemplated for now to happen perhapes an hour north of there if it dose .
come on, just say it.  the Barrie area...
Must be way up there,as I can make it to BPS, IN 35 MINUTES from here  .  25 if I dont have to stop to pick up Terry.

guy says wheres the party and how long will it take me to drive there , then i post IN Barrie and if you ZOOM ZOOM it should take you no time at all , see you there . That sound about right then boys .............
I'm new here but I might be interested, depending on location. I guess I'd better wait until this shakes down a bit and the time and location has been decided upon.
Hey Skipper, I'm in, when you decide when.  I like your place. I can stay in Anten Mills.  PM me with details , when it's settled. Jim

good idea BB....or they could move North too!
Limey, I really don't think they will move north....more like LA someday...Toronto hasn't really embraced the Bill's and I'm wondering if the game up there this year will even sell out.
i'M GOOD for the next 3 years

We will begin planning the 2nd annual Lake Nippising Ice fishing GTG in December. I believe there were 14 OFNers then. This one will be bigger and better then last year and will be definately better. planned.

Can't wait for it!  Skipper "D" you should come join us for the Nipissing hardwater g2g. We have no rules against catching and keeping herring on our lake!

BOQ is in Nov and there is a rather long wait for the F4T event so look what's close to you and see what you can be a part of?  Look up the fishing for Tyler event, see how it's run and see if you can help in your area too?

Skipper, a better question would be, "Are there any OFC get togethers and if so, when and where are they held?"  Don't assume that people are not interested in something because they are not responding to your posts.
We had one in Hamilton a couple of years back. I'd gladly be up for one.
